articles.title: Cardenas Auctions Unveils December Offering on LiveAuctioneers, Bringing Together Warhol, Einstein, Cobain, and Ansel Adams

articles.title: Dr. Kalpana Sundar Brings “Life By Design: Vitality, Wealth and Impact” to San Diego on Jan. 31, 2026 at the Newly Remodeled University Club
articles.summary: Dr. Kalpana Sundar will host a one-day seminar titled “Life By Design: Vitality, Wealth and Impact” on January 31, 2026, at the newly remodeled University Club in San Diego. The seminar focuses on personal mastery through vitality, wealth, and impact, targeting founders, executives, physicians, creatives, and high-achieving professionals. A portion of proceeds supports The Unbound Charitable Foundation, empowering female entrepreneurs. Early registrants enter a giveaway for premium experiences. The event includes networking, meals, and a champagne toast in a luxury setting.

articles.title: Ocugen CEO to Present at Oppenheimer Movers in Rare Disease Summit
articles.summary: Ocugen, a biotechnology leader in gene therapies for blindness diseases, announced that CEO Dr. Shankar Musunuri will present at the Oppenheimer Movers in Rare Disease Summit on December 11, 2025. The presentation will focus on Ocugen's novel modifier gene therapy platform with a gene-agnostic approach to treat rare and age-related blindness diseases. The event includes a fireside chat and one-on-one meetings with investors to discuss business and clinical development strategies.

The report emphasizes the importance of authenticity and cultural fluency alongside AI-driven production.

articles.title: Wellness Briefing: Allbirds’ co-founder launches supplements targeting women’s hormone health, plus news
articles.summary: Joey and Liz Zwillinger, co-founders of Biologica, launched a new line of fizzy drink supplements targeting women's hormone health for reproductive years, perimenopause, and menopause. The brand replaces multivitamins with clinically studied ingredients, third-party testing, and dynamic branding. Biologica raised $7 million in seed funding and plans to expand into retail channels like Target, Costco, and Amazon.

articles.title: How Zoom’s ‘SNL’-powered campaign moves the brand beyond meetings
articles.summary: Zoom launched a global brand campaign called “Zoom Ahead” to reposition itself from a teleconferencing software to an AI-powered collaboration platform. The campaign features a humorous 30-second ad starring SNL comedian Bowen Yang, created by Colin Jost’s No Notes agency. The campaign spans TV, digital, social, and experiential channels and aims to connect brand building with demand generation, emphasizing the emotional aspect of B2B decisions and embedding AI naturally in the product.

articles.title: Lands’ End Announces Third Quarter 2025 Results
articles.summary: Lands’ End, Inc. reported its third quarter 2025 financial results, highlighting a 28% increase in Adjusted EBITDA and a net income of $5.2 million. The company saw growth in its U.S. Digital and Outfitters segments, driven by a strong back-to-school season and new customers. Gross margin improved by approximately 120 basis points. The company is focused on expanding brand relevance and reaching a younger, more diverse customer base. It also announced ongoing strategic alternatives including a potential sale or merger. Guidance for Q4 and fiscal 2025 projects continued growth in revenue and profitability.

articles.title: How Collected is shaking up the traditional resale commission model

articles.title: Gap’s CMO on leveraging the brand’s Katseye success for the holidays
articles.summary: Gap's Global CMO Fabiola Torres discusses the extension of the "Give Your Gift" holiday campaign, which builds on the success of the brand's partnership with rising girl group Katseye. The campaign, featuring a multigenerational choir and rising talent, has generated over 30 million views since its November launch and aims to resonate with Gen Z while maintaining appeal across generations. The campaign follows Gap's earlier successful "Better in Denim" campaign with Katseye, which achieved 8 billion media impressions and strengthened Gap's position in the adult denim market.

articles.title: How the best marketing campaigns of 2025 navigated uncertain times
articles.summary: In 2025, marketers faced significant challenges including global conflict, economic pressures, and sociopolitical tensions. Despite this, successful campaigns leveraged nostalgia, celebrity endorsements, and social-first strategies to engage consumers. Notable campaigns included Chili’s focus on Gen Z with humor and nostalgia, American Eagle’s controversial yet successful Sydney Sweeney campaign, Dove’s creator-led #ShareTheFirst social campaign, Gap’s viral cultural play with Katseye, and Doritos’ edgy humor approach. Brands like KFC and Walmart focused on brand turnarounds and transformations, while Olipop innovated with competitive sparring in the better-for-you soda market. Purpose-driven marketing took a backseat, but brands like E.l.f. maintained commitment to values. Overall, marketers navigated uncertainty by blending authenticity, cultural relevance, and strategic creativity.

articles.title: John F. Crowley, President and CEO of the Biotechnology Innovation Organization (BIO), to Deliver Keynote Address on the Future of Biotech and Rare Disease Innovation at the 2026 MDA Clinical & Scientific Conference
articles.summary: John F. Crowley, President and CEO of the Biotechnology Innovation Organization (BIO), will deliver the keynote address at the 2026 MDA Clinical & Scientific Conference in Orlando, Florida, March 8-11, 2026. His keynote titled "Driving the Future of Innovation, Policy, and Patient Impact" will focus on biotechnology innovation, patient advocacy, and emerging technologies transforming rare disease research and care. The event is the largest global neuromuscular meeting, uniting researchers, clinicians, industry leaders, and advocates.

articles.title: Ernexa Therapeutics Presents New Preclinical Data at American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting on Lead Cell Therapy Candidate for Treatment of Ovarian Cancer
articles.summary: Ernexa Therapeutics announced new preclinical data on its lead cell therapy candidate ERNA-101 for ovarian cancer at the ASH Annual Meeting. The data demonstrated the therapy's ability to reprogram tumor microenvironments to immune-active states, showing promising survival benefits and immune activation. The off-the-shelf iMSC platform secretes cytokines IL-7 and IL-15, promoting immune cell infiltration and prolonged survival in ovarian cancer models. First-in-human trials are planned for next year.

articles.title: Coherus Announces Six-Year JUPITER-02 Follow-up Results Showing LOQTORZI® plus Chemotherapy Nearly Doubles Median Overall Survival in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma
articles.summary: Coherus Oncology announced six-year follow-up results from the Phase 3 JUPITER-02 trial showing that LOQTORZI® (toripalimab-tpzi) plus chemotherapy nearly doubles median overall survival in patients with recurrent or metastatic nasopharyngeal carcinoma. The combination achieved a median overall survival of 64.8 months versus 33.7 months with chemotherapy alone, representing a significant survival benefit and reinforcing LOQTORZI's role as a first-line treatment option.

articles.summary: Fate Therapeutics presented updated Phase 1 clinical data for its FT819 off-the-shelf CAR T-cell product candidate targeting systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), demonstrating meaningful and durable responses with a favorable safety profile. articles.summary: Praxis Precision Medicines presented positive clinical updates at the American Epilepsy Society Annual Meeting, highlighting promising results from the EMBOLD study of relutrigine showing significant seizure reduction and functional improvements in developmental and epileptic encephalopathies (DEEs), and the RADIANT study of vormatrigine demonstrating rapid and sustained seizure reduction in focal onset seizures and generalized epilepsy. articles.title: With search and social visibility shrinking, Aritzia’s 1 million app downloads signal a pivot
articles.summary: Aritzia launched a mobile app on October 28, 2025, which quickly surpassed 1 million downloads split evenly between the U.S. and Canada. The app serves as a brand-owned ecosystem for styling guidance, shopping, and exclusive content, blending influencer and in-house stylist advice. It enables Aritzia to gather rich first-party data in a privacy-governed way, helping refine customer experience and build loyalty amid shrinking search and social visibility. The app reflects a broader industry trend of fashion brands pivoting to mobile to reclaim discovery and data ownership.

articles.title: Activating the long tail: a digital-first strategy for SMB customer acquisition
articles.summary: This article discusses how companies can unlock growth by adopting a digital-first customer acquisition strategy focused on small and medium businesses (SMBs). It highlights the value of SMBs as a significant customer segment often underserved by traditional enterprise-centric approaches. The strategy involves digital customer hubs that integrate data, AI, and automation to personalize engagement, improve customer experience, and drive scalable growth. Key pillars include customer intelligence, lead enrichment, personalized engagement, tailored customer experience, and proactive customer success. The article also outlines considerations for building such digital hubs and the benefits of a marketing-led, scalable, and agile approach.

articles.title: AEO, GEO and accessibility: The 3 forces that will define 2026 marketing
articles.summary: The article discusses three key forces shaping marketing in 2026: AI-driven discovery as the primary driver of brand discovery, the rise of Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) and Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) as core marketing disciplines, and digital accessibility becoming a foundational layer supporting AI optimization. It highlights how accessibility improves AI interpretability, user experience, and compliance, positioning it as essential for future marketing success.

articles.title: Nielsen strengthens ties with Amazon advertisers via audience segments
articles.summary: Nielsen is making its Nielsen Marketing Cloud audience segments available across the Amazon Ads marketplace, enabling advertisers to target specific audiences across categories such as CPG, auto, and finance on Amazon platforms including Prime Video, Freevee, Twitch, Fire TV, and Amazon.com. This partnership allows advertisers to access Nielsen’s proprietary data sets through Amazon DSP and Amazon Marketing Cloud data clean room, enhancing targeted advertising and cross-platform ad delivery.

articles.title: US Soccer’s CMO on its World Cup campaign as brands take the pitch
articles.summary: U.S. Soccer launched the “Never Chase Reality” campaign ahead of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, highlighting the U.S. Men’s National Team's journey and fan connection. The campaign, created in-house, runs across multiple channels and is informed by a psychological profile of soccer fans. CMO Catherine Newman discusses the campaign's emotional storytelling, media strategy, and the importance of community and inclusivity in soccer.

articles.title: Advertising growth resilient in face of tariff, AI disruption: report
articles.summary: WPP Media revised its full-year revenue projections upward by over two percentage points as areas like retail media and gaming attract investment. The advertising market is more resilient than expected despite disruptions from tariffs and AI. Global ad revenue is forecasted to grow 8.8% in 2025 and 7.1% in 2026, driven by content-driven advertising, retail media, gaming, and AI-powered search.

articles.title: ALX Oncology Announces Positive Results from Ongoing Investigator-Sponsored Phase 2 Trial Evaluating Evorpacept in Combination with Standard-of-Care Treatment in Patients with Indolent B-cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, at ASH Annual Meeting
articles.summary: ALX Oncology announced positive Phase 2 trial results for evorpacept combined with rituximab and lenalidomide in untreated indolent B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma patients. The combination showed a 92% complete response rate, surpassing historical 50% rates for the standard regimen. The trial was presented at the ASH Annual Meeting 2025.

articles.title: Ascentage Pharma Presents Pivotal China Registrational Study Data for Lisaftoclax in Oral Report at 2025 American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting
articles.summary: Ascentage Pharma presented pivotal Phase II registrational study data for Lisaftoclax, an oral Bcl-2 selective inhibitor, at the 2025 ASH Annual Meeting. The study demonstrated significant and durable clinical efficacy and a manageable safety profile in heavily pretreated BTK-refractory relapsed/refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma (CLL/SLL) patients in China, supporting its NDA approval by China's NMPA. Lisaftoclax achieved a 62.5% objective response rate and a median progression-free survival of 23.89 months with no tumor lysis syndrome reported. The drug shows promise for high-risk patient subgroups with complex karyotypes and TP53 mutations.

articles.title: Nurix Therapeutics Presents New Data Demonstrating Durable, Deepening Responses in Phase 1 Trial of Bexobrutideg (NX-5948) in Patients with Relapsed or Refractory Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) at the 67th American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting & Exposition
articles.summary: Nurix Therapeutics announced new clinical data from its ongoing Phase 1a/1b study of bexobrutideg (NX-5948) in patients with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL). The data demonstrate an objective response rate of 83% including two complete responses, with a median progression-free survival of 22.1 months. The 600 mg dose showed higher efficacy and a favorable safety profile, supporting its advancement as the recommended Phase 2 dose in the pivotal DAYBreak program. The company will host a webcast on December 8, 2025, to discuss the data.

articles.title: Io Therapeutics presents today at the American Society for Hematology Annual Meeting, preclinical studies demonstrating combination treatment with BCMA CAR-T cells plus the company's RXR agonist compound IRX4204 has synergistic efficacy against human multiple myeloma
articles.summary: Io Therapeutics announced at the American Society of Hematology studies of their RXR agonist IRX4204 in combination with BCMA CAR-T cells and lenalidomide showing synergistic efficacy against human multiple myeloma in preclinical models. The compound IRX4204 enhances CAR-T cell persistence and anti-tumor function by suppressing ferroptosis and promotes ferroptosis in myeloma cells, improving therapeutic outcomes. These findings support future clinical trials combining IRX4204 with CAR-T cells and lenalidomide for multiple myeloma treatment.

articles.title: Bicara Therapeutics’ Preliminary Phase 1b Expansion Cohort Data Evaluating 750mg of Ficerafusp Alfa Weekly Plus Pembrolizumab Advances Pivotal Study Dose Selection on Track for First Quarter 2026
articles.summary: Bicara Therapeutics presented preliminary Phase 1b data evaluating 750mg weekly dose of ficerafusp alfa combined with pembrolizumab in first-line HPV-negative recurrent/metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma. The data showed a 57% overall response rate and a safety profile consistent with higher doses. The company plans to declare the optimal biologic dose for the pivotal FORTIFI-HN01 Phase 2/3 study in Q1 2026.

articles.title: Moonup Technology 携手欧洲智能家居领军者 Shelly，将于 2025 年台北国际建筑建材暨产品展 (2025 Taipei Building Show) 展示完整智能建筑生态系统
articles.summary: Moonup Technology, the Taiwan partner of European smart home leader Shelly Group, will showcase a complete smart building ecosystem at the 2025 Taipei Building Show from December 11 to 14. The exhibition focuses on 'Minimal Renovation, Maximum Intelligence,' demonstrating how buildings can achieve flexible smart upgrades with minimal construction and reduced renovation costs. Shelly Group is recognized globally for its innovative, open, and high-precision smart home architecture, with over 28.8 million devices installed worldwide. Moonup Technology is advancing towards capital market listing and global expansion, aiming to combine European smart home technology with local R&D and system integration capabilities to create an international smart building brand in Taiwan.

articles.title: Moonup Technology Bermitra dengan Pemimpin Rumah Pintar Asal Eropa, Shelly, untuk Menampilkan Ekosistem Bangunan Pintar Lengkap di Taipei Building Show 2025
articles.summary: Moonup Technology Co., Ltd., mitra operasi Shelly di Taiwan, akan menampilkan ekosistem bangunan pintar lengkap milik Shelly pada Taipei Building Show 2025. Dengan tema “Renovasi Minimal, Kecerdasan Maksimal,” pameran ini menyoroti solusi bangunan pintar yang fleksibel dan efisien biaya. Shelly Group dikenal sebagai pemimpin global dalam teknologi rumah pintar dengan lebih dari 2,5 juta pengguna dan 28,8 juta perangkat terpasang di lebih dari 100 negara. articles.title: Kymera Therapeutics to Announce KT-621 BroADen Phase 1b Atopic Dermatitis Trial Results on December 8, 2025
articles.summary: Kymera Therapeutics, a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company, will announce results from the BroADen Phase 1b clinical trial evaluating KT-621, an oral STAT6 degrader, in patients with moderate to severe atopic dermatitis on December 8, 2025. The announcement includes a press release at 7:00 a.m. ET followed by a video conference call and webcast at 8:00 a.m. ET. KT-621 is a first-in-class oral degrader targeting STAT6, showing promising safety and biomarker reduction in Phase 1 studies. Ongoing Phase 2b trials in atopic dermatitis and planned trials in asthma aim to accelerate development and dose selection for Phase 3 studies.

articles.title: “On December 6, We Remember”: Community members honour the memory of murdered women and girls with a Shoe Memorial in New Westminster
articles.summary: On December 6, BC food workers with the United Food and Commercial Workers Locals 247 and 1518 held their 21st annual Shoe Memorial at Hyack Square in New Westminster to commemorate the National Day of Remembrance and Action on Violence Against Women. The event featured a public display of hundreds of pairs of shoes symbolizing women murdered in British Columbia, with shoes later donated to shelters. Community members handed out literature and engaged the public to raise awareness about gender-based violence.

articles.title: Biogen and Stoke Therapeutics Present Data that Further Support the Disease-Modifying Potential of Zorevunersen, an Investigational Medicine for the Treatment of Dravet Syndrome, at the 2025 American Epilepsy Society (AES) Annual Meeting
articles.summary: Biogen Inc. and Stoke Therapeutics presented long-term Phase 1/2a and open label extension data for zorevunersen, an investigational antisense oligonucleotide for Dravet syndrome, at the 2025 American Epilepsy Society Annual Meeting. The data demonstrate durable seizure reductions, increased seizure-free days, and improvements in cognition, behavior, and quality of life. A propensity score weighted analysis showed significant reductions in seizures compared to natural history controls. EEG analysis supports a disease-modifying mechanism. Zorevunersen has been generally well tolerated with ongoing Phase 3 EMPEROR study enrollment.

articles.title: Amneal Announces Positive Interim Phase 4 ELEVATE-PD Results With CREXONT® for Parkinson’s Disease
articles.summary: Amneal Pharmaceuticals announced positive interim results from its ongoing Phase 4 ELEVATE-PD study evaluating CREXONT®, an extended-release carbidopa and levodopa formulation for Parkinson’s disease. The first 55 patients showed significant improvements in daily “Good On” time, reductions in “Off” time, and improved motor symptom control after switching to CREXONT. The study highlights CREXONT as a key therapy advancement in a category with limited innovation, with longer-term data expected in 2026.

articles.title: Wugen to Present Correlative Data and Long-Term Follow-Up Updates for Off-the-Shelf, Allogeneic CD7-Targeted CAR-T Cell therapy at the 2025 ASH Annual Meeting
articles.summary: Wugen, a clinical-stage biotechnology company, announced the presentation of Phase 1/2 correlative data and long-term follow-up updates for its off-the-shelf, allogeneic CD7-targeted CAR-T cell therapy, Soficabtagene Geleucel (Sofi-cel), at the 2025 ASH Annual Meeting. Sofi-cel is being evaluated in a pivotal trial for relapsed or refractory T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoblastic lymphoma. The therapy showed promising expansion, persistence, and safety in early studies, with ongoing pivotal trials enrolling patients.

articles.title: Biomea Fusion Presents COVALENT-111 Study Results at the 23rd World Congress on Insulin Resistance, Diabetes & Cardiovascular Disease (WCIRDC)
articles.summary: Biomea Fusion presented results from the COVALENT-111 clinical study at the 23rd WCIRDC, demonstrating durable glycemic and C-peptide improvements with icovamenib, a selective menin inhibitor targeting beta-cell restoration in insulin-deficient type 2 diabetes. The study showed sustained treatment effects up to 9 months post last dose, with good tolerability and potential as a novel diabetes therapy.

articles.title: SunX "Trade to Earn" Debuts and Hits $410M in Trading Volume, as Negative-Fee Incentive Ignites Perp DEX Market
articles.summary: SunX launched its "Trade to Earn" campaign featuring a negative-fee incentive that has driven over $410 million in trading volume within days. The campaign offers full rebates on trading fees plus additional $SUN token rewards, targeting high-frequency and strategy traders. The initiative aims to boost liquidity and market depth on SunX's decentralized perpetual futures exchange, with a total prize pool of $1.35 million USDT and a buyback-and-burn model to support token value. The campaign ends on December 6, 2025.

articles.title: ORIC® Pharmaceuticals Presents Enozertinib Data in NSCLC Patients with HER2 Exon 20 Mutations at the ESMO Asia Congress 2025
articles.summary: ORIC Pharmaceuticals announced Phase 1b trial data of enozertinib in NSCLC patients with HER2 exon 20 mutations presented at ESMO Asia Congress 2025. The trial showed a 35% objective response rate with manageable safety and low discontinuation. Enrollment in this patient population is completed with no further development planned. A conference call and webcast are scheduled for December 6, 2025.

articles.title: Ulta Beauty CEO shares holiday sales focus, 12.9% sales jump and a shelf shakeup to grow fragrance sales
articles.summary: Ulta Beauty reported a 12.9% net sales increase to $2.9 billion for the quarter ending November 1, driven by Black Friday sales, over 33,000 in-store events, and growth in fragrance and skin care categories. CEO Kecia Steelman highlighted a strategic shelf expansion for fragrance in over 60% of stores to capture holiday demand. The company saw a 3.8% increase in average ticket value and a 2.4% increase in transactions, with fragrance as the strongest growing category. Hair-tool sales declined due to tariffs, while mass makeup and skin-care brands showed strong performance.

articles.title: How Netflix’s $72B Warner Bros. deal changes the streaming calculus

articles.title: See What’s Next in Beauty and Wellness at Questex’s Be+Well New York Show, March 8-10, 2026
articles.summary: Questex's Be+Well | Beauty and Wellness Show New York is a major industry event taking place March 8-10, 2026 at the Javits Center, featuring over 650 exhibitors and master-level education for beauty, spa, wellness, and fitness professionals. The event merges The International Beauty Show and International Esthetics, Cosmetics & Spa Conference, adding fitness and wellness elements, new exhibitor neighborhoods, and robust education tracks. Notable speakers and top brands like Dyson and ULTA Beauty will participate. Registration and media pass applications are open.

articles.title: Marius Pharmaceuticals CEO Shalin Shah Invited to Speak at Landmark FDA Expert Panel on Testosterone Replacement Therapy for Men
articles.summary: Marius Pharmaceuticals announced that CEO Shalin Shah will speak at the FDA Expert Panel on Testosterone Replacement Therapy for Men on December 10, 2025. articles.title: Senti Bio to Host Conference Call and Webcast to Discuss SENTI-202 Clinical Data Being Presented at the American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting 2025 on Tuesday, December 9th at 8:00 AM ET
articles.summary: Senti Biosciences, Inc. announced it will host a conference call and webcast on December 9, 2025, to discuss updated clinical results from SENTI-202, a first-in-class Logic Gated off-the-shelf CAR-NK cell therapy targeting hematologic malignancies. The call will be hosted by CEO Timothy Lu, MD, PhD, and President Kanya Rajangam, MD, PhD, with participation from Nosha Farhadfar, MD. SENTI-202 is designed to selectively target AML and MDS cancer cells while sparing healthy bone marrow cells. The webcast will be accessible on the company's website and archived for 90 days.

articles.title: Veru to Present at The Society on Sarcopenia, Cachexia, and Wasting Disorders 18th International Conference and Regulatory and Clinical Trials Update Regulatory Workshop
articles.summary: Veru Inc., a late clinical stage biopharmaceutical company, announced multiple presentations at the Society on Sarcopenia, Cachexia, and Wasting Disorders 18th International Conference and Regulatory Workshop in Rome, Italy. The presentations focus on novel therapeutic approaches to address muscle wasting and obesity, including Veru's drug enobosarm. Veru is also planning a Phase 2b clinical study to evaluate enobosarm's efficacy in obesity treatment alongside GLP-1 RA drugs.

articles.title: Remedy Plan Therapeutics to Present Results from Phase 1 Healthy Volunteer Study of NAMPT Inhibitor RPT1G and Other Progress at the 67th American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting and Exposition
articles.summary: Remedy Plan Therapeutics announced positive results from its first-in-human Phase 1 healthy volunteer study of the NAMPT inhibitor RPT1G, demonstrating favorable safety and significant target engagement. The company will present these findings and ongoing trial designs at the 67th ASH Annual Meeting. RPT1G shows promise as a novel treatment for hematological malignancies with a well-tolerated safety profile and potent anti-tumor efficacy in preclinical models.

articles.title: La conférence annuelle 2025 « True Story of Inner Mongolia » (La véritable histoire de la Mongolie-Intérieure) s’est tenue à Hohhot
articles.source: The Organizing Committee of the 2025 True Story of Inner Mongolia Annual Conference
articles.summary: The 2025 annual conference "True Story of Inner Mongolia" was held in Hohhot on November 29, 2025, gathering experts, scholars, media professionals, and representatives from various sectors to explore innovative ways to share the authentic story of Inner Mongolia globally. The event highlighted the region's rich culture, industrial capabilities, and dynamic development through new media campaigns involving influencers with over 20 million followers, achieving over 100 million online views with the hashtag #TrueStoryofInnerMongolia. The conference emphasized integrated communication strategies, quality content, and emotional resonance to enhance the region's brand image and international recognition.

articles.title: Jahreskonferenz „Die wahre Geschichte der Inneren Mongolei” 2025 findet in Hohhot statt
articles.summary: Am 29. November 2025 fand in Hohhot die Jahreskonferenz „True Story of Inner Mongolia“ statt, bei der Experten, Wissenschaftler und Medienvertreter Strategien zur internationalen Kommunikation und Markenbildung der Inneren Mongolei diskutierten. Die Konferenz betonte die Bedeutung integrierter Kommunikation, neuer Medien und emotionaler Resonanz, um die vielfältige Identität der Region global bekannt zu machen.

articles.title: The beauty gifts teens want for the holidays
articles.summary: This episode of the Glossy Beauty Podcast explores the beauty gifts teens want for the holidays, featuring insights from 13-year-old Indy and Anna Andreeva, managing director of footwear, beauty and brands at Piper Sandler. The discussion highlights the popularity of fragrance, the enduring appeal of the E.l.f. brand among teens, and the influence of friends and social media influencers on teen beauty wishlists.

articles.title: Fashion Briefing: Footwear brands at the FFANY trade show discuss tariffs and changing consumer habits
articles.summary: At the FFANY trade show in New York City, major footwear brands including Wolverine World Wide, Toms, Crocs, and others discussed challenges such as tariffs, product expansion, and changing consumer habits. Wolverine is navigating tariff impacts with a diversified manufacturing strategy and focusing growth on key cities for brands like Saucony. Toms is undergoing a turnaround with new leadership and plans for collaborations and limited editions to tap into fast-moving fashion trends.

articles.title: Consumers in 2026 will be full of paradoxes, predicts Dentsu
articles.summary: Dentsu's 2026 trends report reveals consumers will embody paradoxes, embracing AI while seeking traditional, unplugged lifestyles. Key trends include a rise in fandoms, complex relationships with AI, a turn to traditional values, loneliness-driven social behaviors, and a growing interest in analog aesthetics. Marketers are advised to blend technological intelligence with emotional intelligence to succeed.

articles.title: Skims ventures into live entertainment with shoppable TikTok livestream

The event featured exclusive holiday deals, celebrity guests, and was produced with OBB Media. This initiative aims to engage Gen Z consumers on social media and capitalize on the growing social commerce trend.

articles.title: Subway promotes revived Sub Club loyalty program in alliterative ads
articles.summary: Subway has launched a national ad campaign promoting the return of its Sub Club loyalty program, which offers customers a free fourth footlong after purchasing three. The campaign emphasizes entertainment and humor over transactional messaging, differentiating it from other QSR value marketing. The program includes additional benefits like Subway Cash, exclusive offers, and birthday perks. Subway supports the campaign with TV ads, digital, social, CRM, and influencer marketing.

articles.title: Glad teams with Oscar the Grouch to revive ‘Don’t Get Mad. Get Glad.’
articles.summary: Glad, the maker of trash bags and food wraps, has revived its decades-long campaign, “Don’t Get Mad. Get Glad.,” featuring Sesame Street's Oscar the Grouch in a two-minute musical spot remixing his song “I Love Trash.” The campaign includes a social media giveaway of Grouch-inspired trash bag totes on TikTok and Instagram, and will run across multiple platforms including longform content, cutdowns, and social teasers. The effort aims to connect with younger audiences nostalgic for Sesame Street while promoting Glad products that help manage trash concerns.

articles.title: Longeveron Chief Science Officer and Chief Medical Officer Selected as Speakers at the Global CardioVascular Clinical Trialists (CVCT) Forum
articles.summary: Longeveron Inc.'s Chief Science Officer Dr. Joshua Hare and Chief Medical Officer Dr. Nataliya Agafonova were selected as speakers at the Global CardioVascular Clinical Trialists (CVCT) Forum held December 8-10, 2025 in Washington, D.C. They will participate in panel discussions focusing on cell therapy for heart failure and streamlining cell therapy innovation. Longeveron is a clinical stage biotechnology company developing regenerative medicines including laromestrocel (Lomecel-B®), an allogeneic mesenchymal stem cell therapy for conditions such as pediatric dilated cardiomyopathy and Alzheimer's disease.

articles.title: Devnexus 2026 Showcases the Powerful Intersection of AI, Java, and Modern Developer Tooling in Atlanta
articles.summary: Devnexus 2026, organized by the Atlanta Java Users Group, is the largest Java ecosystem conference in the U.S., returning to Atlanta March 4-6, 2026. The event features 100+ sessions and workshops focused on AI, Java, cloud-native engineering, and developer productivity tooling, bringing together thousands of developers and technology leaders. Key topics include generative AI, modern Java development, and developer practices. The conference highlights top speakers from leading global companies and offers immersive hands-on workshops.

articles.title: For Global Cooperation and Solidarity, The 2025 Imperial Springs International Forum Kicks Off in Guangzhou
articles.summary: The 2025 Imperial Springs International Forum was held from December 1-3, 2025 in Guangzhou, China, bringing together over 200 distinguished guests including former heads of state, government leaders, international experts, and business leaders from more than 30 countries. The forum focused on global cooperation and solidarity, discussing topics such as global security challenges, AI governance, green development, and global economic trends. The event featured multiple sessions and forums aimed at fostering dialogue and advancing global governance and cooperation.

articles.title: UnionPay Hosts Global Partners Conference 2025 - Innovations in Open Payments: Sharing Success in Payment Connectivity, Building a Connected Global Payment Network with the New Four-Party Model
articles.summary: UnionPay hosted its Global Partners Conference 2025 in Shanghai, signing 11 cross-border payment cooperation documents with major institutions worldwide. The event highlighted UnionPay's efforts to build a connected global payment network through an open and inclusive New Four-Party Model, integrating various stakeholders to enhance payment connectivity, security, and efficiency. The conference emphasized AI adoption in payments to improve risk management and fraud detection, aiming to support global payment industry development and benefit merchants and users worldwide.

articles.title: Taoxichuan Taoran Craft Market : une foire culturelle qui met en valeur la créativité originale de Jingdezhen
articles.summary: Du 28 au 30 novembre 2025 s’est tenu le 13e Taoran Craft Market à Taoxichuan, Jingdezhen, réunissant plus de 400 stands d’artisanat original et proposant un programme culturel varié. Organisé par le Jingdezhen Ceramic Culture Tourism Group, cet événement est une plateforme culturelle emblématique qui valorise les traditions artisanales, la créativité juvénile et le mode de vie culturel contemporain. Le marché favorise les liens entre culture, créativité, design et développement communautaire, attirant des visiteurs du monde entier.

articles.title: Taoxichuan Taoran Craft Market: eine Kulturmesse, auf der die originelle Kreativität von Jingdezhen präsentiert wird
articles.summary: Vom 28. bis 30. November 2025 fand der 13. Taoran Craft Market im Weimin Porcelain Factory Block von Taoxichuan in Jingdezhen statt. Die Veranstaltung bot über 400 Stände mit originellem Kunsthandwerk und ein vielfältiges Kulturprogramm. Organisiert von der Jingdezhen Ceramic Culture Tourism Group, hat sich der Markt zu einer bedeutenden kulturellen Plattform entwickelt, die handwerkliche Traditionen, jugendliche Kreativität und zeitgenössischen Lebensstil präsentiert. Der Markt fördert die Verbindung von Kultur, Kreativität, Design und urbanem Raum und zieht Besucher aus aller Welt an.

articles.title: Ernexa Therapeutics Announces Oral Presentation at the 67th American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting
articles.summary: Ernexa Therapeutics announced that data from its novel cell therapy platform will be shared in an oral presentation at the 67th ASH Annual Meeting in December 2025. The presentation highlights preclinical findings supporting ERNA-101, their lead therapy candidate for ovarian cancer, which uses gene-modified iPSC-derived MSCs to convert immunosuppressive tumor microenvironments into pro-inflammatory ones to activate the immune system against cancer.

articles.title: Xenon Announces Investor Webinar Highlighting Azetukalner and Epilepsy Data from AES 2025
articles.summary: Xenon Pharmaceuticals Inc. announced an investor webinar on December 10, 2025, to present new data on azetukalner and epilepsy from the AES 2025 meeting, including long-term study results and real-world data. The webinar will also provide updates on commercialization progress for azetukalner, a novel epilepsy treatment in Phase 3 trials.

articles.title: Biodesix to Present New Data at Two Major Upcoming Scientific Meetings
articles.summary: Biodesix, Inc. will present new clinical utility data for its Nodify Lung® tests at the North American Conference on Lung Cancer (NACLC) and development data for a new ultra-sensitive ESR1 assay for breast cancer at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium (SABCS). The presentations highlight advancements in lung cancer diagnostics and breast cancer treatment resistance monitoring. Biodesix also received awards at the ISPOR Europe 2025 Meeting for research on pulmonary nodule-related healthcare costs.

outreach_templates.email_body:

[Your Name]
outreach_templates.linkedin_message: Hi Natalie, I saw Biodesix is presenting new data at NACLC and SABCS. I'd love to connect and learn more about your latest innovations and explore potential collaboration.

articles.title: Wellness Briefing: How top wellness brands are showing up at Art Basel Miami
articles.summary: Wellness and fitness brands including Ammortal, Tonal, and TechnoGym are leveraging Art Basel Miami and Miami Art Week to showcase experiential activations targeting wealthy consumers. Ammortal is debuting its high-end health-stacking chamber at The Wellness Oasis pop-up event, while Tonal and TechnoGym offer immersive home gym experiences and wellness checkups. These activations aim to grow brand awareness and drive conversions among affluent attendees. Additional wellness industry news includes executive moves, new fitness app launches, and sponsorships.

articles.title: From UGC to R&D: POV Beauty’s Ani Hadjinian on leveraging community for every product launch
articles.summary: POV Beauty CEO Ani Hadjinian discusses how the brand leverages creator intuition, community feedback, and social commerce to drive product development and launches. The brand launched with a skin prep range developed with Korean manufacturers, focusing on high-performance formulations and social media demonstrability. Community input shapes R&D and product iterations, while sampling and PR efforts include both influencers and community members. The brand aims to scale with operational discipline and creator-led innovation, blending digital and physical retail strategies.

articles.title: PepsiCo’s Mug brand finds Gen Z sweet spot: fragrance, dogs and TikTok
articles.summary: PepsiCo’s Mug Root Beer brand targets Gen Z holiday shoppers with a limited-edition Daddy’s Home cologne launching exclusively on TikTok Shop. The $15 bundle includes a 10-pack of mini cans and is supported by a social video spoofing mainstream cologne ads, TikTok Live events, and influencer content featuring the brand's bulldog mascot. The campaign leverages Gen Z's affinity for fragrance, social media, and pet ownership, aligning with TikTok's growing e-commerce push.

articles.title: Why Keurig grounded its new brand platform in post-pandemic realities
articles.summary: Keurig launched a new brand platform, "Great Coffee Without the Grind," focusing on simplicity and consumer realities in the post-pandemic landscape. The campaign includes digital video spots across major streaming platforms and aims to position Keurig as an antidote to complicated coffee culture. Developed by Publicis' KDPOne unit, the platform supports upcoming product launches and the company's strategic split following the acquisition of JDE Peet’s.

articles.title: American Eagle’s celebrity-led marketing turns sales growth positive
articles.summary: American Eagle Outfitters reversed a negative sales trend in Q3 with a 1% growth at its namesake brand, driven by celebrity-led marketing campaigns featuring Sydney Sweeney, Travis Kelce, and Martha Stewart. The campaigns boosted loyalty and product demand, especially in denim and menswear, while sister brand Aerie saw stronger 11% sales growth. Executives highlighted the importance of impactful marketing to build long-term brand excitement and customer loyalty.

articles.title: How Oreo maker Mondelēz is rethinking snack marketing with AI
articles.summary: Mondelēz International developed a generative AI tool called AIDA to personalize advertising and boost engagement across its snack brands like Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, and Ritz. The tool, launched in July after over two years of development and $40 million investment, aims to create marketing content faster and at lower cost, enabling personalized content for specific consumer groups. Mondelēz is still refining the technology to ensure brand fidelity and responsible advertising, with plans to expand AIDA's use across other parts of the business.

articles.title: Taoxichuan Taoran Craft Market: A Cultural Fair Showcasing Jingdezhen's Original Creativity
articles.summary: The 13th Taoran Craft Market took place from November 28 to 30, 2025, at the Weimin Porcelain Factory Block of Taoxichuan in Jingdezhen. Featuring over 400 original craft stalls and diverse cultural activities, the event showcased Jingdezhen's handcrafted traditions, youthful creativity, and contemporary cultural lifestyle. Organized by Jingdezhen Ceramic Culture Tourism Group, the market has evolved into a signature cultural platform connecting young designers, independent brands, and cultural organizations with audiences, fostering cultural renewal and community development.

articles.title: Red Wing’s newest campaign critiques drop culture and AI
articles.summary: Red Wing, a century-old premium work boot brand, launched a new campaign called “Boots Drop The Hard Way” that critiques sneaker drop culture and generative AI. The campaign highlights tradespeople, features billboards made by them, a social campaign, and a contest where tradespeople can win free boots for life by breaking open heavy-duty shoe boxes. The campaign emphasizes durability, craftsmanship, and the brand's value proposition of long-lasting boots amid a modernization effort.

articles.title: Boss, Lancôme open virtual boutiques with Snapchat’s shoppable AR
articles.summary: Snapchat has partnered with luxury brands Chopard, Boss, and Lancôme to launch the Snapchat Winter Village, a shoppable augmented reality experience featuring three virtual boutiques. The activation, available through December 31, allows users to explore branded virtual stores and shop products via the brands' e-commerce sites. The experience aims to replicate in-person shopping and appeal to Gen Z consumers who prefer physical retail experiences. The activation is accessible through Snapchat’s Lens Carousel and each brand’s public profile.

articles.title: Breaking down the marketing silos: The real integration challenge
articles.summary: Marketing teams face significant challenges due to organizational silos, which create confusion, waste spend, and block collaboration. According to research by EMARKETER and Zeta, 40% of marketers identify silos as their top obstacle. The article emphasizes that fixing these silos is a people and process issue rather than a technology problem. It advocates for unified, deterministic customer data to align marketing efforts around real business outcomes and drive profitable customer growth.

articles.title: Why your agency’s state of incorporation should be a core business decision
articles.summary: This sponsored article explains how the choice of state for agency incorporation—Delaware, Nevada, or Wyoming—impacts agency growth by influencing talent recruitment, client appeal, and cost efficiency. Delaware aligns agencies with VC-backed clients and funding readiness, while Wyoming and Nevada offer operational cash flow advantages and privacy. The article advises agencies to align their legal structure with long-term goals, emphasizing the importance of foreign qualification compliance and expert consultation.

articles.title: ORA Developers Group anuncia su debut en el LPS Shanghái, con lo que refuerza su presencia mundial de 45.000 millones de dólares
articles.summary: ORA Developers, líder mundial en desarrollos inmobiliarios y destinos de estilo de vida visionarios, anuncia su debut en el Luxury Property Showcase (LPS) en Shanghái, marcando un hito en su expansión internacional. Presenta una colección selecta de desarrollos costeros emblemáticos en Emiratos Árabes Unidos, Chipre y el Caribe, con una cartera valorada en más de 45.000 millones de dólares. articles.title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: Merit leans into humor with its ‘The Five Minute Face Off’ campaign
articles.summary: Merit, a 5-year-old beauty brand, launched its first evergreen brand campaign titled 'The Five Minute Faceoff,' starring former SNL stars Ego Nwodim and Heidi Gardner. The campaign uses humor to address the pressures women face daily and aims to increase brand awareness and improve brand sentiment without promoting a specific product. The campaign debuted on social media platforms and has received positive engagement and high watch-through rates.

articles.title: Luxury Briefing: Sentaler goes international as luxury outerwear demand intensifies
articles.summary: Sentaler, a Canadian luxury alpaca outerwear brand, is expanding internationally with its first U.S. boutique on Madison Avenue amid strong demand for luxury outerwear. The brand reports 50% year-over-year growth in the U.S. and is extending its retail presence with seasonal boutiques and trunk shows. Sentaler's growth aligns with shifting holiday shopping behaviors favoring timeless, aspirational gifts. The brand's celebrity endorsements have been organic, and it targets loyal customers with private appointments. The Madison Avenue boutique features a new 'cherry lacquer' motif, symbolizing growth and tapping into current trends.

articles.title: Molson Coors says ‘Just Bring the Beer’ in bid to millennials, Gen Z
articles.summary: Molson Coors launched the 'Just Bring the Beer' campaign targeting millennials and Gen Z, positioning beer as a simple, affordable option for holiday gatherings. The campaign highlights multiple Molson Coors brands and is piloted in select U.S. cities with billboards, retail activations, social media, and creator partnerships. It reflects younger consumers' preference for experiences over traditional gifts and runs through the end of the year.

articles.title: Bitget es coanfitrión de “SENSES”, una experiencia audiovisual en Londres que fortalece la participación de la UEX en el Reino Unido
articles.summary: Bitget, la bolsa universal (UEX) más grande del mundo, coorganizó un evento audiovisual inmersivo llamado SENSES en Londres el 28 de noviembre de 2025. El evento exclusivo reunió a fundadores, inversores, operadores VIP y personas influyentes para fomentar conversaciones significativas y asociaciones orgánicas en el ecosistema Web3 del Reino Unido. Esta activación forma parte del compromiso continuo de Bitget con el mercado del Reino Unido, incluyendo colaboraciones con OffChain, la comunidad artística local y organizaciones académicas como la Universidad de Bristol y la London School of Economics.

The event targets a select group of about 150 guests including founders, investors, VIP traders, and influencers to foster meaningful conversations and strengthen the Web3 ecosystem in the UK. This event is part of Bitget's broader commitment to the UK market, following a series of high-impact activations and collaborations with OffChain, ARTSECT Gallery, and academic institutions such as the University of Bristol and London School of Economics. articles.summary: Bitget, the world's largest Universal Exchange (UEX), co-hosted an exclusive immersive audiovisual event called SENSES in London on November 28, 2025, in partnership with OffChain and ARTSECT Gallery. This event is part of Bitget's broader commitment to the UK market, following a series of impactful activities in 2025 including collaborations with OffChain Bristol, Bristol Crypto & Web3, and academic partnerships with the University of Bristol and the London School of Economics. articles.title: Anthem and Chartier Partner to Build Life-Sized Gingerbread House at Calgary’s Holiday Wonder Event
articles.summary: Anthem Properties and Chartier bakery have partnered to build a life-sized gingerbread house as the centerpiece of Calgary's Holiday Wonder event at the BMO Centre from November 27 to January 3. Anthem, as title sponsor, designed and built the structure, while Chartier provided hundreds of pounds of gingerbread. The event is family-friendly and includes giveaways of mini gingerbread houses at Anthem's Calgary showhomes. A media preview was held on November 27 with representatives available for interviews.

articles.title: Cellectis organise un webinaire dédié aux actionnaires français le jeudi 4 décembre 2025
articles.summary: Cellectis, a clinical-stage biotechnology company, will hold a webinar on December 4, 2025, to present promising clinical data for lasmé-cel in relapsed/refractory B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia, discuss the phase 2 pivotal trial design, registration pathway, and commercial potential. The webinar will also cover updates on the éti-cel program for relapsed/refractory non-Hodgkin lymphoma, strategic collaborations, and recent scientific advances. Presenters include CEO André Choulika, SVP Laurent Poirot, and CFO Arthur Stril. The event targets French shareholders and includes a Q&A session.

articles.title: Chongqing's Dazu District in Southwest China to Host Young Scholars for Innovative Grotto Conservation
articles.source: The People's Government of Dazu District, Chongqing
articles.summary: The 2025 international academic exchange activity for young grotto researchers, part of the Asian Alliance for Cultural Heritage Conservation's Youth Ambassador Program, will be held in Dazu District, Chongqing. Over 100 young scholars from multiple countries will engage in innovative approaches to grotto temple conservation, focusing on digital technologies and cultural heritage preservation. The event is co-hosted by several cultural and governmental organizations and aims to foster international cooperation and youth involvement in cultural heritage protection.

articles.title: China's Pengzhou Builds "Pengzhou Lifestyle" as City Identity
articles.summary: From November 20 to 22, 2025, the Global Panda Partners Conference highlighted Pengzhou's innovative integration of culture, tourism, ecology, and urban development, establishing the 'Pengzhou Lifestyle' as a distinctive city identity. Pengzhou was recognized as a top innovative model for cultural and tourism integration, promoting a lifestyle brand supported by unique local resources, signature IPs, and a growing portfolio of outdoor sports and cultural events. The city attracted nearly 19 million visitors and generated over 11 billion yuan in tourism revenue in 2025.

articles.title: Major Drilling to Release Results for its Second Fiscal Quarter on December 10, 2025

articles.title: Goodfood Reports Fiscal Year and Fourth Quarter 2025 Results with Net sales of $121 million and $25 million, Gross Profit of $50 million and $10 million and Adjusted EBITDA¹ of $6 million and $0.4 million, respectively
articles.summary: Goodfood Market Corp. announced its fiscal year and fourth quarter 2025 financial results, reporting net sales of $121 million for the year and $25 million for the quarter, with gross profits of $50 million and $10 million respectively. The company highlighted the launch of Heat & Eat meal solutions and Genuine Tea, which have positively impacted product mix. Despite a challenging macro environment and ongoing cost pressures, Goodfood delivered positive adjusted EBITDA for both periods and is focused on operational review, product evolution, and customer experience to drive sustainable profitability and growth.

articles.title: Why fashion companies are launching mobile apps, despite the ‘high barrier of entry’

articles.summary: This special holiday crossover episode of the Glossy Beauty Podcast features hosts Lexy Lebsack, Danny Parisi, and Gabi Barkho discussing strategies for shoppers, brands, and retailers to win Black Friday. articles.title: European Authors Day 2025: #ReadForReal Launches Across Europe
articles.summary: The European Authors Day 2025 celebrations under the slogan #ReadForReal have launched across Europe, co-funded by the EU Creative Europe Programme. Over 200,000 participants in 25 countries will engage in nearly 3600 initiatives. The Universal Reading Foundation leads the consortium coordinating this continent-wide celebration to raise literacy and critical thinking.

articles.title: DPM Metals Announces Robust Feasibility Study Results for the Čoka Rakita Project with $782M of NPV5% and 36% IRR
articles.summary: DPM Metals Inc. announced the results of a feasibility study for the Čoka Rakita gold project in Serbia, confirming robust economics with a $782 million NPV at 5% discount and a 36% IRR based on a $1,900/oz gold price. The project features increased mineral reserves and gold production, low costs, and is advancing towards construction start in early 2027 with first concentrate production expected in 2029. The company emphasizes strong local stakeholder engagement and plans to leverage existing processing infrastructure.

articles.summary: The vitamin sticker category is growing with transdermal patches delivering active ingredients like Vitamin D, ashwagandha, and NAD+. The primary consumers are women aged 28-45, with brands focusing on awareness and education. The category appeals to consumers seeking convenience, self-expression, and alternatives to oral supplements.

The new store offers made-in-store food, a frozen yogurt bar, multiple coffee blends, and a variety of fuel options including diesel and DEF. This marks a significant expansion for RaceTrac into the North Carolina market, adding approximately 30 new jobs to the community.

articles.summary: Vaseline, a billion-dollar brand under Unilever, has achieved 11% compound annual growth over four years through strong marketing and product innovation. The brand emphasizes social-first, creator-led content and cultural relevance, exemplified by campaigns like "Vaseline Verified" and collaborations such as the Loverboy iced tea partnership. Marketing efforts integrate innovation and demand creation teams to stay aligned with fast-moving cultural trends, driving significant sales uplift and consumer engagement.

articles.title: Why American Eagle tapped Martha Stewart to extend beyond Gen Z
articles.summary: American Eagle partnered with celebrity homemaker Martha Stewart for its holiday campaign "Give Great Jeans" to expand its reach beyond Gen Z. The campaign targets a multigenerational audience of gift givers and recipients, spanning digital, social, and connected TV channels. The collaboration includes a 30-second spot featuring Stewart and denim-themed visuals, aiming to provide an uplifting moment amid economic pressures. The campaign builds on American Eagle's strategy to broaden its customer base during the holiday season while maintaining its core denim focus.

articles.title: Salomon plans to double its number of US stores next year
articles.summary: Salomon, the French sportswear brand, currently operates five stores in the U.S. and plans to double its number of stores to around 10 next year. The brand is expanding its retail footprint to complement its wholesale presence and better own its narrative in the U.S. market. Store concepts vary by location, with New York stores focusing on lifestyle and fashion, while the Chicago store emphasizes performance. Key target markets for expansion include Los Angeles and Miami.

articles.title: Omnicom-IPG deal on path to close Wednesday following EU approval
articles.summary: Omnicom Group expects to complete its $13 billion-plus acquisition of Interpublic Group by Wednesday after receiving unconditional approval from the European Union. The merger will create the world's largest marketing services provider amid ongoing agency consolidation. The deal highlights synergies in media, healthcare, and precision marketing, with potential agency brand changes and workforce reductions. The acquisition reflects evolving agency priorities, including AI and data-driven marketing, and follows a Federal Trade Commission consent order on ad spend policies.

articles.title: Uber debuts first national holiday ad as focus on suburbs grows
articles.summary: Uber released its first national holiday ad titled "Close," focusing on a suburban marketing push. The ad tells an emotional father-daughter story set to a cover of Fleetwood Mac's "Landslide," highlighting complicated family relationships during the holidays. Developed with agency Mother and directed by Michael Spiccia, the campaign runs across cinema, connected TV, online video, and social media in the U.S. and Canada. Uber views suburban markets as a significant growth opportunity, especially during heavy holiday travel periods.

articles.title: Sephora reorganizes US marketing department
articles.summary: Sephora has reorganized its U.S. marketing department over the past year to improve efficiency and effectiveness, impacting 27 roles without reducing workforce. The changes create new marketing positions offering mobility and recruitment opportunities. This reorganization follows the appointment of a new U.S. chief marketing officer and aligns with broader changes in Sephora's North American operations.

articles.title: Why Kraft Mac & Cheese went hypercontextual for ‘Best Thing Ever’ push
articles.summary: Kraft Mac & Cheese launched its largest media investment to date with the 'Best Thing Ever' campaign, positioning the brand as an experience rather than just a product. The campaign uses a hypercontextual approach with over 70 assets across TV, connected TV, YouTube, social, and OOH, aiming to reinforce cultural relevance and compete with private label and premium competitors. The campaign features ads voiced by comedian John Mulaney and is supported by creative agency Rethink, in-house shop The Kitchen North America, PR from Alison Brod Marketing + Communications, and paid media from Carat.

articles.title: Delivering effective in-store messaging: evidence-based best practices
articles.summary: Vestcom presents a comprehensive guide offering evidence-based best practices for in-store messaging that effectively turns shopper intent into action. The guide combines insights from thousands of campaigns and recent shopper research to help brands design impactful messages that drive measurable sales results. Key strategies include leading with value beyond price, matching messages to shopper moments, connecting physical and digital experiences seamlessly, and measuring campaign impact to optimize and scale success.

articles.title: Value is winning holiday sales as TJX, Ross and Walmart surge, Target tumbles
articles.summary: Holiday shoppers are prioritizing value as a flurry of big-box earnings were reported this week. Sales at off-price retailers like Ross and TJX, parent company to TJ Maxx, Marshalls and Homegoods, soared while spending at Walmart increased and Target tumbled. According to company leaders, TJX sales are driven by lower-income individuals, while Walmart saw its number of wealthy shoppers grow.

articles.title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: Inside MCo Beauty’s ultimate dupe — a prestige experience, totally free
articles.summary: Last weekend, over 4,000 people lined up on New York City's Mott Street to experience MCo Beauty's first pop-up. The brand's main goal, according to CMO Meridith Rojas, was to build community.

articles.title: Luxury Briefing: Malone Souliers adapts to a polarized luxury market under new CEO Andrew Wright
articles.summary: In this week’s Luxury Briefing, a look at how small, independent labels are adapting to a shifting luxury landscape. Plus, new insights from Bain and Altagamma on the state of the global market. In earnings, updates from Mulberry and LuxExperience. Executive moves include a key appointment at Versace. And in News to Know, app launches, brand relaunches, strategic resets and geopolitical tensions shape the week.

articles.title: Glossy Podcast: Inside the rise of the Ralph Lauren Christmas trend
articles.summary: International reporter Zofia Zwieglinska and editor-in-chief Jill Manoff are joined by Preston Konrad, founder of the home and fragrance brand Preston Lane, to talk about the biggest holiday trend of the season: Ralph Lauren Christmas.

articles.title: Gap ties viral marketing to retail results as Gen Z relevance rises
articles.summary: A recent campaign with girl group Katseye delivered 8 billion media impressions and contributed to double-digit gains in the adult denim category.
