articles.summary: Over six months since introducing its refreshed aluminum packaging, Saint James Iced Tea is enjoying the benefits of a glow up. The startup beverage maker moved away from cartons this spring and the difference was felt instantly.

articles.title: Nostalgia Is the “Secret Sauce” For Shake Up Cocktails
articles.summary: It’s not often that the genesis for a ready-to-drink (RTD) cocktail happens beyond a bar or a boardroom, but, in the case of Shake Up Cocktails, inspiration struck at a Midwest state fair.

articles.title: Reviews: Fruit Flavors Sparkle For Pura Soda, Lemonati Lemonade
articles.summary: Fruit and bubbles are always a winning pair, as we see in this week's reviews, which features fruit-flavored cane sugar sodas from Pura Soda alongside a pair of bubbly lemonades from Lemonati.

articles.title: TiNDLE Will Divest U.S. Operations to Focus on Private Label Products in Europe
articles.summary: Alt-meat food tech startup TiNDLE announced today plans to pivot its business model to focus exclusively on private label operations in the European market.

articles.title: Issei Sees Significant Sales Lift From ‘Transformative’ Packaging Refresh, Viral TikTok
articles.summary: In conjunction with its three-year anniversary, Issei is swapping its minimalist packaging design for a bold, colorful new look that has already led to a sales pick-up both online and in brick-and-mortar retail.

articles.title: Analyzing America’s Grocery Carts
articles.summary: A new report by nutrition intelligence company FoodHealth Co. and NielsenIQ suggests U.S. shoppers are falling short when it comes to the healthiness of household food purchases.

articles.title: Reviews: RIND Granola Squares, Lentiful Thanksgiving Feast, Better Sour Tart Cherry
articles.summary: In this reviews roundup, we taste the latest from RIND, Lentiful and Better Sour, evaluating the taste, texture, positioning and more of each product.

articles.title: CPG Week Podcast: Hemp’s Ticking Clock, The Supplements-To-Energy Pipeline
articles.summary: On the CPG Week Podcast, the team discusses the impending hemp ban, Gopuff's $250 million and supplement makers launching energy drinks.

articles.title: The new consumer journey, according to the CMO of Assembly
articles.summary: Ask a dozen marketers, and some will say the customer journey has, in turn, collapsed, condensed, lengthened, looped, died and been born anew. What’s not up for debate is that it has fundamentally changed. That’s what Global CMO of Assembly Bria Bryant helped unpack when we met for a morning of shopping and shop talk.  […]

articles.title: As resale platform Vinted eyes an $8.7 billion valuation and US expansion, UK users push back
articles.summary: Vinted is expanding to the U.S. as it eyes a $8.7 billion valuation, but U.K. users say the platform’s latest changes are now driving them away.

articles.title: Fashion Briefing: How brands are showing up trackside at this week’s F1 Las Vegas Grand Prix
articles.summary: This week, we’re taking a look at the Formula 1 Las Vegas Grand Prix, which begins on Thursday and runs through the weekend. A plethora of fashion, beauty and skin-care brands are hosting brand activations on-site at the race, reflecting the sport’s growing popularity among women.

articles.title: T3 founders Dr. Julie Chung and Kent Yu on creating the luxury hair tool category, plus news
articles.summary: Few beauty executives currently compete in a category they created, but that’s the case for Dr. Julie Chung and Kent Yu, the married co-founders behind T3 hair tools. Glossy sat down with the duo to discuss how they're navigating their biggest challenges, balancing retail and DTC, maintaining NPD standards in a faster-is-better world, and competing within the category.

articles.title: McDonald’s lets the Grinch take over with holiday campaign
articles.summary: Along with a meal inspired by the Dr. Seuss icon, the seasonal effort features a TV spot, creator-led gaming program and Times Square ads.

articles.title: Target to launch ChatGPT app with multi-item baskets, fresh food
articles.summary: The mass retailer is deepening its work with OpenAI as consumers continue to turn to generative chatbots for shopping support.

articles.title: Creator ad spend to reach $37B as marketers turn to AI for scale: IAB
articles.summary: While nearly three-quarters of advertisers already use or are planning to use AI in the next year to boost efficiency in the creator space, concerns remain.

articles.title: Carnival combats screen-induced ‘fun deficit’ with new brand platform
articles.summary: New ads starring Nick Offerman tackle doomscrolling while showing the actor enjoying cruise activities like waterslides and bungee jumping.

articles.title: How Danone optimizes creator-driven ads as investment surges
articles.summary: CreativeX has developed creator content benchmarks to help advertisers bridge the gap between authenticity and measurable effects.

articles.title: Monster launching energy drink for women to compete with Alani Nu
articles.summary: Monster Beverage announced the launch of Flirt, a new energy drink positioned toward female consumers and competing directly with Alani Nu.

outreach_templates.email_subject: Verified Gen Z sampling opportunities for Flirt
outreach_templates.email_body:
Hi Hilton,

We operate a sampling network focused on Gen Z across major college campuses, and we specialize in verified, fraud-free product trial.

Given Monster’s announcement of Flirt, and its positioning toward female consumers, we can support your launch by distributing samples directly to students and verifying every redemption using only the student’s phone number.

Brands only pay on unique, verified redemptions—no duplicates, no recycled samples, and no inflated numbers. There are no upfront fees or placement costs.

If exploring a campus-driven push for Flirt is on your radar, I’d be glad to share how this system works.

Best,
Jonas
outreach_templates.linkedin_message: Hi Hilton — saw Monster’s announcement of Flirt. We run a verified Gen Z sampling network across major college campuses, where every sample is tied to a unique student phone number. If you ever explore college-driven trial for Flirt, I'd be glad to share how our verification system works.

articles.title: BevNET Live L.A. 2025: Special Cannabev Sessions Discuss Category Trajectory for 2026
articles.summary: The recent change to the 2018 Farm Bill that mandates the end of the hemp-based beverage business hit like an earthquake, but for now, at least, the buildings are still standing. Under the law, there’s now an expiration date for the manufacture of intoxicating hemp drinks – and, in fact, most of the $28 billion U.S. hemp business: Nov. 12, 2026.

articles.title: Liquid Death Lands West Coast DSDs Ahead of Energy Launch
articles.summary: The new agreements add Sunset Distributing – a subsidiary of Hand Family Companies covering the Southern California market – as well as Pacific Northwest houses The Odom Corporation, Bigfoot Beverages and Summit Beverage Distribution Co.

articles.title: Suja Files For IPO
articles.summary: Another cold chain company is heading for a public market exit. Suja Life, Inc. announced that it has confidentially submitted a draft registration statement on Form S-1 with the U.S. Security and Exchange Commission (SEC).

articles.title: Zevia On “Stable Foundation” Says CEO; Profitability, More Distribution in 2026
articles.summary: Zevia CEO Amy Taylor detailed her company’s plan to drive productivity savings and reach profitability while scaling within a highly competitive space, part of a wide-ranging strategy discussion at the Stephens Annual Investment Conference in Nashville this week.

articles.title: Adult Non-Alc Brand Aplós Closes $5M To Fuel Expansion
articles.summary: Functional adult non-alc spirits brand Aplós has closed a $5 million funding round, the company announced today.

articles.title: BevNET 2025 Spirits Awards: Submit Your Nominations by This Friday 11/21
articles.summary: There are only two days left to submit your nominations for BevNET's 2025 Spirits Awards! Nominations close this Friday, November 21.

articles.title: Can Tariff Cuts And Mass Discounts Lower Holiday Grocery Bills?
articles.summary: Grocery prices remain elevated with Thanksgiving on the horizon, despite tariff rollbacks and mass channel pricing actions.

articles.title: Melt Organics Acquires Miyoko’s Creamery
articles.summary: Prosperity Organic Foods, Inc., The parent company of plant-based butter brand Melt Organics, has been revealed as the winning bidder of Miyoko’s Creamery, which was liquidated two weeks ago.

articles.title: Prada, Maybelline and Prose are 2025 Glossy Beauty & Wellness Award finalists
articles.summary: The 2025 Glossy Beauty & Wellness Awards recognize the companies transforming the beauty and wellness industries through design, product development, sustainability and more in innovative and emotionally resonant ways. For instance, in the Best Sustainability Initiative category, Prada Beauty is a nominee for its global sustainability work, including its refillable skincare, makeup and fragrance systems. […]

articles.title: Wellness Briefing: L’Oréal targets ‘patsumers’ as line between wellness and beauty softens
articles.summary: This week, I checked in with executives from L’Oréal-owned La Roche-Posay to hear about the burgeoning "patsumer" consumer category, new learnings on how consumers feel about scarring and details on the company’s forthcoming scar-care launch strategy. Additionally, Peloton pops up at F1 in Las Vegas, GNC rolls out a consumer-facing research initiative, NordicTrack launches an at-home pilates reformer, and annual longevity spending is set to reach $8 trillion by 2030.

articles.title: The chance to win the holiday marketing season has already come and gone, according to Traackr’s holiday report
articles.summary: According to Traackr’s 2025 Holiday Shopping Report, the brands that are poised to succeed, when it comes to holiday social media campaigns, are those that have been engaging their social audiences all year long.

articles.title: CMOs see support for brand building fade while ROI scrutiny rises: NIQ
articles.summary: Fewer marketers see CEOs and CFOs backing long-term brand investment while confidence in brand purpose has plunged in a divided climate.

articles.title: How Unilever is pushing sports marketing beyond broadcast convention
articles.summary: Set to nearly double its spend on U.S. sports marketing, the CPG giant sees the category as emblematic of a shift to “many-to-many” marketing.

articles.title: How Gen Z is reshaping holiday marketing — and what brands can do about it
articles.summary: The cohort’s reliance on social media and influencers for product discovery remains, while new levels of comfort with retail media and AI take shape.

articles.title: BellRing Closes FY25 Up Double-Digits on Protein Hype, Outlook Shaky
articles.summary: Revenue remained strong in its Q4 and fiscal year 2025 earnings report today, but BellRing Brands – maker of Premier Protein and Dymatize – fell short of analyst expectations despite outperforming throughout the fiscal year.

articles.title: From Steady to Strategic: The Supply Chain Forces Shaping 2026
articles.summary: The Q4 2025 Supply Chain report from Agrowgate paints a picture of a beverage industry entering 2026 with far more stability - yet no shortage of strategic inflection points.

articles.title: Marketing: Blake Lively’s ‘Betty’ Drinks Join Holiday Menu at Serendipity3
articles.summary: Betty Buzz and Betty Booze are collaborating with New York City restaurant Serendipity3 on a limited edition holiday menu, “Sip into the Season,” available through December.

articles.title: Report: BeatBox Exploring $700M Sale To Anheuser-Busch InBev
articles.summary:
Anheuser-Busch InBev (A-B) is reportedly in talks to acquire party punch brand BeatBox, according to a story by the Wall Street Journal.

Citing unnamed “people familiar with the matter,” the WSJ estimated the deal at $700 million, but couched that negotiations could “fall apart.”

BeatBox would give A-B a soaringly popular entrant in the ready-to-drink (RTD) cocktail space with differentiated packaging. BeatBox’s rainbow-hued 500 …

articles.title: Monster’s 2026 Bev-Alc Slate: 1st Spirits RTD Just Vibe, Stunt Double Lager & 10% Beast Variants
articles.summary: Monster Brewing’s 2026 innovation slate will include a pair of lagers and the company’s first spirits-based, ready-to-drink (RTD) offering. CEO Hilton Schlosberg teased the new products but offered few details during the company’s Q3 earnings call earlier this month.

articles.title: BellRing Closes FY25 Up Double-Digits on Protein Hype, Outlook Shaky
articles.summary: Revenue remained strong in its Q4 and fiscal year 2025 earnings report today, but BellRing Brands – maker of Premier Protein and Dymatize – fell short of analyst expectations despite outperforming throughout the fiscal year.

articles.title: R.I. Food Incubator Hope & Main Breaks Ground on New Kitchen
articles.summary: Non-profit food business incubator Hope & Main has broken ground on a new commercial kitchen in Providence, R.I., slated for a grand opening in Spring 2026. The shared-use facility will be located in Providence’s West End neighborhood.

articles.title: Barry Callebaut Taps NotCo AI to Boost Chocolate Innovation
articles.summary: Chocolate manufacturer Barry Callebaut has partnered with NotCo to explore using artificial intelligence to develop new chocolate recipes.

articles.title: Holiday Seasonals Propel My Better Batch into Nationwide Distribution With Target
articles.summary: Premium baking mix brand My Better Batch is expanding its distribution partnership with Target, which will carry two new exclusive seasonal cookie mixes – Holiday Cheer and Chocolate Peppermint – nationwide beginning this month.

articles.title: How Rudes Denim and other story-driven independent brands are winning today’s value-conscious consumers
articles.summary: Madison Rosenberg, founder & CEO, SIMON Communications, and head of PR for Rudes Denim For decades, the fashion industry was built on the assumption that the biggest brands always win as they tend to have more budget, recognition, shelf space and overall influence. But the consumer landscape has shifted. Today’s shoppers, especially Gen Z and […]

articles.title: How an oral care brand is bringing professional quality to the personal care market
articles.summary: The clean personal care category is evolving — and oral care brand Coslus is looking to help define what comes next. For Coslus, the future isn’t just about clean ingredients. Rather, it’s about developing products that feature both clean ingredients and professional-grade performance, and making those products accessible to consumers. Across the beauty and wellness […]

articles.title: Beauty Briefing: How demand for longevity is driving the perfume market
articles.summary: This week, I checked in on how the demand for high-performing fragrances is driving new technologies and product categories. Additionally, both L’Oréal and The Estée Lauder Companies made global investments, and Hourglass founder Carisa Janes introduced a new beauty line.

articles.title: Brands sound off on what tech investments make sense, at Glossy’s AI Commerce Strategies Town Hall
articles.summary: During the virtual AI Commerce Strategies Town Hall, hosted exclusively for Glossy+ and Modern Retail+ subscribers, retail executives discussed the burning questions they have related to AI.

articles.title: With ‘serious but manageable’ new tariffs on Switzerland, the watch industry braces for long-term effects
articles.summary: For the Swiss, the recent tariff rate change from 39% to 15% was reason to breathe a sigh of relief. But the Swiss watch industry will still have to adjust to a new reality in which prices in its largest market will inevitably rise.

articles.title: Nosh Announces Nominees for ‘Best of 2025’ Awards
articles.summary: The nominees for Nosh’s “Best Of 2025” Awards, presented by trüfrü, reflect the depth and creativity across today’s food landscape.

articles.title: Trump Rolls Back Reciprocal Tariffs On Select Foods Imports
articles.summary: The Trump Administration signed an order on Friday amending reciprocal tariff rates on select food items unable to be grown, produced or procured in the U.S.

articles.title: Keychain Nets New $10M, Launches Retailer AI Tool
articles.summary: Keychain has secured another $10 million in investment as it launches its newest tool for sourcing private-label manufacturers.

articles.title: Exclusive: Credo Beauty rolls out ‘Credo Qualified’ contract manufacturer certification program, ‘Clean Beauty Council’ to guide its standards
articles.summary: Clean beauty retailer Credo is on a mission to demystify beauty’s historically secretive contract manufacturing sector. On Monday, the retailer announced a first-of-its-kind CM certification program called Credo Qualified, as the retailer doubles down on its role in making beauty’s supply chain more transparent for consumers.

articles.title: Charlotte Tilbury tops the beauty category in Dash Social’s first Total Social Impact leaderboard
articles.summary: In 2025, gauging social media impact goes far beyond tracking a straightforward follower count or number of likes. With the introduction of its new proprietary metric known as the Total Social Impact metric, the social media management platform hopes to offer a more holistic view of a brand’s social reach.

articles.title: Glossy+ Research: Investors share advice for founders looking to raise capital
articles.summary: This month, Glossy brought together a group of investors in the consumer brand space. The investors represent a wide variety of brands in fashion, beauty, skin care, wellness, tech, food and groceries. They spoke about the state of the investment landscape, including why brands are having a hard time securing money and what constitutes good growth for brands right now.

articles.title: H&M introduces Pre Loved shop-in-shop with LA’s Wasteland
articles.summary: L.A’.s vintage lovers are getting a new stop on their weekend circuit. On Thursday, H&M is opening a permanent "Pre Loved" shop-in-shop at its new North Beverly Drive store, in partnership with Wasteland. The shop's assortment includes designer finds, leather staples and H&M archive gems. It marks H&M's second Pre Loved shop in the U.S. after debuting in Soho last year.

articles.title: TreeHouse Foods Goes Private, Redefining CPG at CVS, Froot Loops Jewelery & More
articles.summary: This week, we're all climbing up a tree to talk hemp while looking our fall finest in some very fetching mozzarella scarves. Hey, what more could you ask for?

articles.title: Demystifying The Drug Store Channel at Nosh Live 2025: How To Launch and Scale at CVS
articles.summary: CVS Pharmacy is redefining what it means to be a community wellness destination, expanding its assortment to include more better-for-you and emerging food and beverage brands on its shelves. How do brands become part of that strategy? Attendees at Nosh Live 2025 (Dec. 4+5) in L.A. will learn what makes a brand a good fit for CVS and what trends are resonating most with consumers in this fast-changing channel.

articles.title: Prime Shrimp Unveils Fresh Brand Identity Surfacing Bold Products, Fierce Clarity, and a New Brand System
articles.summary: Prime Shrimp announced a complete brand refresh including new logo, packaging, and in-store presentation designed to better communicate its shrimp products to shoppers.

outreach_templates.email_subject: Campus sampling ideas for Prime Shrimp’s refreshed brand
outreach_templates.email_body:
Hi Grace,

I saw the recent Food Dive press release about Prime Shrimp’s brand refresh and updated packaging. The positioning around ease, flavor, and getting shrimp into the weekly rotation feels like a strong fit for college students who want something fast but still premium.

We run a sampling network focused on Gen Z across major college campuses. Everything is verified by phone number so each sample is tied to a unique student, and brands only pay on verified redemptions (no duplicates, no recycled samples, no inflated counts).

If you’re interested in testing Prime Shrimp with college students – especially around quick at-home meals and freezer-friendly proteins – I’d be happy to share how we handle distribution, verification, and reporting.

Would you be open to a quick conversation?

Best,
Jonas
